title.narrative: Resilient Livelihoods through Private Sector Development (ReLive PSD)

description.narrative: The proposed project aims to contribute to safeguarding the livelihoods of the Afghan people in the Herat province to help mitigate the impact of the humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan. The project will implement UNIDO tested capacity building approaches to recover, restore and improve livelihood among existing MSMEs and along selected agro-processing value chains, contributing to enhancing food security. In addition, the project will also support youth and women-led new business start-ups. The project will deliver the livelihood promotion interventions with the Community Development Councils (CDCs) and local support institutions such as teaching institutions, community-based and local associations, whose capacities the project will enhance. Through training, B2B discussions and shared learning experience, the project will provide MSME owners and managers whose businesses are still operating with Industrial development concepts and tools such as entrepreneurship, Lean Manufacturing, Total Quality Management tailored to their levels. This is to help keep their operations going to preserve current employment levels if not to expand.
